questions.prompt: Who will you make amends to first?
questions.help: Discuss the order with your sponsor.

questions.prompt: What specific amends do you need to make to this person?
questions.help: Be clear about what you're apologizing for and what you'll do.

questions.prompt: How will you approach this person?
questions.help: Consider the setting, timing, and your words carefully.

questions.prompt: Could making this amend cause harm to this person or others?
questions.help: Some amends should not be made if they would cause further harm.

questions.prompt: Describe an amend you've made. How did it go?
questions.help: Reflect on the experience, regardless of the outcome.

questions.prompt: How did the person respond to your amend?
questions.help: Their response is not within your control.

questions.prompt: How did you feel after making this amend?
questions.help: Many people feel relief and freedom.

questions.prompt: What did you learn from making this amend?
questions.help: Each amend teaches us something about ourselves.

questions.prompt: Is there someone who refuses to accept your amend or won't speak with you?
questions.help: You can only do your part; their response is up to them.

questions.prompt: How do you feel about this situation?
questions.help: It's okay to feel disappointed or hurt.

questions.prompt: What can you do to find peace with this outcome?
questions.help: Sometimes acceptance is the only option.

questions.prompt: Do you owe anyone money? How much?
questions.help: Financial amends may need to be made over time.

questions.prompt: What is your plan for repaying this debt?
questions.help: Make a realistic plan you can keep.

questions.prompt: Are there people you cannot make direct amends to? (deceased, lost contact, etc.)
questions.help: Indirect amends can still heal.

questions.prompt: What indirect amends can you make? (charity, changed behavior, helping others, etc.)
questions.help: Living well is a powerful amend.

questions.prompt: How are you making living amends through changed behavior?
questions.help: Actions speak louder than words.

questions.prompt: What patterns have you changed to avoid repeating past harms?
questions.help: Recovery is about building a new life.

questions.prompt: How has making amends changed your relationships?
questions.help: Consider both repaired and new relationships.

questions.prompt: How has making amends changed you?
questions.help: Reflect on your growth and healing.

questions.prompt: What promises of recovery are you experiencing?
questions.help: Peace, freedom, and usefulness to others.

questions.prompt: Are there any amends you're avoiding? Why?
questions.help: Continued fear or pride may need addressing.

questions.prompt: How will you continue to make amends as part of your ongoing recovery?
questions.help: Step Ten will help maintain this practice.
